name: Barbados Beach Club

reviews.text: Booked myself in here for a long weekend and thoroughly enjoyed my time in Barbados!
reviews.title: Friendly and welcoming!

likes.liked: — The hotel staff's overall friendliness and politeness
likes.disliked: — The pool was a bit on the small side, as was the selection of food at the buffet restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is definitely no 5-star, but the room was clean and the staff were very friendly and polite.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island, wonderful holiday, great hotel!

likes.disliked: — The fact I had to leave didn't fill me with joy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet meals were a bit of a disappointment - but I did not have time to check out the hotel restaurants, so I cannot comment on those.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guys who deal with the watersports are a great laugh and not intimidating in the slightest (important to me as I was travelling alone), and the beach outside the hotel is gorgeous.
reviews.title: Quiet & Relaxing

likes.disliked: — Family resort bar closed in the evening. No Tea or Coffee making facilities in bedrooms.

reviews.title: butlins in barbados!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: St Lawrence Gap is just a walk along the beach and if you fancy travelling further afield, you can arrange day trips and other activities through the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic week at the Barbados Beach Club resort although we'd loved to have stayed longer. Our upgraded Superior room was large, clean, comfortable with a great view of the pool. The food was great and you can go up as many times as you like. The hotel's beach was beautiful and you don't get bothered by people trying to sell you things it was very chilled out (the Bajan way) We can strongly recommend this hotel to all. There was also entertainment on every night but we'd definately recommend a night at St Lawrence Gap, especially Jumbies Bar & Restaurant. We also hired a Mini Moke for the day for about £30 and went touring the island. Found a lovely beachfront restaurant at Holetown called Cocomo's where the food, drink and beach were fantastic. Harrison's Caves are definately worth a visit too. We will definately go back again.
reviews.title: Loved Barbados
fab
reviews.text: What can i say, got moved there as where we were booked originally was vile and all i can say is that its fantastic there. great staff, great selection of food and its right on the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment every night and its not far from the shopping centre in Bridgetown. Staff here cant do enough for you. Some guys on the beach who are always very friendly and happy to teach you some water sports (Ricky is fab).
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised
Excellent Value For Money
reviews.text: There are two hotels practically opposite each other so you can go visit either one. Very nice swimming pool which is very warm once you have been swimming in the sea. Another great thing about this place is that there is always a nice breeze which beleive me is very much appreciated as its too hot without it.
very much recommended if you just want to chill out, have a few beers and enjoy the shows.
reviews.title: Improved

reviews.text: The resort is in 2 parts. The older club which overlooks the sea and the newer family resort which is across the road. The family resort apparently acts as an overspill for the club & closes when demand is low. I stayed at the Club for 5 nights in Feb 2008 with my wife & 6 year old daughter. We did wander over to the family resort & it seemed very quiet with just a few couples around the pool.
reviews.title: Butlins, but without the entertainment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean & spacious with very efficient air conditioning. TV had about 8 channels including BBC World. Most rooms (including ours) surround the central area. The disadvantage of this is that the nightly entertainmentis about 40 yards away so you don't get any peace until midnight when it stops. The patio doors were very old & required myself & my wife to close them as one had to pull & the other push.
reviews.title: Great Location !

reviews.text: Beach
reviews.title: Non pretentious, great fun

likes.disliked: — food was a bit ordinary ut you get what you pay for

reviews.text: Lovely clean white beach with powder white sand & a great outlook. No shortage of beds on the beach. Forget about the watersports - the only thing that moved was the hobie cat which went out one afternoon. Apparently conditions were too rough the rest of the time. Plenty of jet skis to hire. My daughter had her hair braided by a very nice lady called Janice who has a stall outside Turtle beach resort which is just up the beach from the club.
reviews.title: Beautiful trip

reviews.text: We stayed in the family building across the road from the main Hotel. Lovely and quiet. All the staff was so friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: We loved every minute of it!

likes.disliked: — Not enough fruit, only fruit at breakfast time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the meals in the SeaRock and The Italian. Buffet meals in the main restaurant was maybe a little limited.
reviews.title: Never again!

likes.disliked: — Food, hot water supply and hygiene

reviews.text: Tip! If you stay here walk down to the pier in Oistins and watch the turtles!!
reviews.title: loved it!!..

reviews.text: There are few places that I would say 'never again' but Barbados Beach Club is one of them.....the experience of broken concrete walkways, broken lights, broken sun beds, dirty stairways and most important of all appalling food has led me to say this about the Barbados Beach Club.
reviews.title: Loved it All

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, lots of storage/hanging space, great view, plenty of hot water and quiet air con.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was virtually empty when we arrived in mid-December. The first night I couldn't believe the food, the only fresh fruit to be had was in the mornings, ice cream was never on offer, at times the desserts selection was empty. Food from the day before was resurrected by pouring a sauce over it and calling it something else. The rep didn't want to know.
reviews.title: Barbados is excellent!

aka: Barbados Beach Club Hotel Christ Church
